page.title: 03ATTITUDES:WOODTON AREA
page.content: Despite social,economic & agricultural changes in the past 30 years,the pace of living in our rural communities still allows time for the minor courtesies:there is a marked friendli- ness in all walks of life; native parochialism still expects & receives support at local functions such as the School Fete or Flower Show.Inevitably there has been a weakening of this attitude owing to the need to look for work beyond the villages.The car makes it easy to shop at supermarkets, threatening the village shop.Earlier almost total involvement in farming has given way to regarding the farmers as "they",not "us".It is of interest to note the strong attachment in villages to their churches,probably the oldest signs of civilisation; coupled with the burial ground of their forbears they command respect.
